content:
‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I tried this contribution in Python and loved it! 
The statement is clean and the equations easy to understand. 

The contribution lets you practice basic concepts: conditional structure, types and comparison operators. Very good for beginners.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Good Job. Your clash is really a good idea. I literally got stuck for 10 min because I didn't see the 'square root' in the last condition.... Really good clash

Hi @Pinkpantherika :-) !
I would suggest 2 things, please :
1) Firstly "a times b" seems to refer to "a multiplied by b", isn't it ? it was not easy for me ...
2) without writing it directly as a formula, can you provide parenthesis in your explanations, please ? for example : "(a plus b) divided by 2" ?
-> Thanks for your contribution.

‚úÖ Approved the contribution.
Comment: I like the puzzle and I also find it quite educational
Ok, thank you for the feedback!

Your contribution has been uploaded twice. Please remove one of them. The other link is:
https://www.codingame.com/contribute/view/8152628d23cb2dcc072897b6f8439fb91afab

Goal
* Please format all "a", "b" and "s" as [[variables]], e.g. "a" should be changed to "[[a]]".

* Please format "Arithmetic" as a {{constant}}.

* Please include an explanation of "Geometric", "Harmonic" and "Quadratic". Clashes should focus on testing programming skills instead of maths knowledge.

Input
* Please change "On the first line you will have 2" to "<<Line 1>>: 2 space-separated".

* Please change "On the second line you will have 1 string" to "<<Line 2>>: A string [[s]]".

Output
* Please change "You will output" to "<<Line 1>>:".

Constraints
* Please format all [[variables]].

* Please be consistent and change the variable name "S" to "s".

* Please format the four possible words for [[s]] as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Cases
* Each pair of test and validator should be similar but not the same. For example, while both Test 1 and Validator 1 cover "Geometric", the values of a and b should be different.

Thanks.

P.S. Please consider keeping the contribution in "WIP" status instead of "Ready for approval" when you publish it initially.

Thank you.

Please change "2 natural space-separated numbers" to "2 space-separated natural numbers".

Is there a way to explain the four possibilities in words instead of providing formulas for direct copy-and-paste to the solution code?

P.S. Please reply to comments directly, otherwise the person who makes the comment won't get a notification and won't know that you've replied. üòâ
I will try to find explanations instead of the formulas. It‚Äôs my first time so please excuse the faulty writing and all of that. Thank you so much for guiding me and giving feedback on the problem!
